justification: “Across three experiments, participants viewed a series of fantasy animals called Fennimals… Participants were tasked to choose one toy to give to each of these new Fennimals. …this allowed for an inference as to which training-set Fennimals were recalled based on the item selected by the participant.”

topic_or_construct: use of indirectly related episodic experiences
measured_by: modified Fennimals Task with unavailable directly-related item (Experiment 2)
justification: “During the test phase participants encountered a novel Fennimal… Participants could not select the toy associated with this directly overlapping Fennimal, but could select the toy associated with the indirectly associated (paired) Fennimal.”

topic_or_construct: retrieval speed for direct vs. indirect episodic recall
measured_by: reaction-time recording during Fennimals test trials (Experiment 3)
justification: “Participants were significantly faster to select the predicted item in direct trials than in indirect trials… We observed no difference in reaction times for trials in which participants selected one of the not-predicted toys.”
